New Records: The Cavaliers are the first team in NBA history to win their first 10 games and score at least 110 points in each of them.
The Cavaliers also are the first team to start 10-0 since the 2015-16 Warriors.
Key Match Events: Darius Garland scored 27 points and Evan Mobley had 23 as the Cavaliers routed the Golden State Warriors 136-117.
The Cavaliers built a 41-point halftime lead at 83-42.
Pre-Game Insights: Kenny Atkinson's high-powered offense has been a great fit for Cleveland.
Atkinson's up-tempo style quickly won over the face of the franchise, All-Star shooting guard Donovan Mitchell.
Post-Match Reflections: Kenny Atkinson noted that the team has a long way to go, a lot of stuff to clean up.
Evan Mobley stated that the team knows they can be better and they're not going to stop working until they get there.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers have outshot their opponent in each game but have won the rebounding battle only four times.
The Cavaliers also committed 20 turnovers that led to 32 points for the Warriors.
Others: The Associated Press contributed to this report.
